item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1094 (MySQL settings in wp-config.php) created
item.dc:creator: NuclearMoose
item.description:
From this post in the support forums: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=27152#post-152600

Apparently it is not obvious that a person MUST retain the single quotes around the DB_NAME etc., when editing this file. I suggest adding some additional wording to the comments.

* For detailed instructions on editing this file, refer to ​http://codex.wordpress.org/Editing_wp-config.php *

item.title: Ticket #1093 (Automatic content-type negotiation) updated
item.dc:creator: idanso
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1093 (Automatic content-type negotiation) created
item.dc:creator: idanso
item.description:
While delivering mostly validating xhtml content, wordpress does not currently support sending it's documents as application/xhtml+xml mime type: ​http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-media-types/

There is a "hidden pref" in 1.5 that allows setting an explicit content-type('html_type'), but it performs no content negotiation, thus blocking non-xhtml browsers.]

This patch obsoletes the 'html_type' pref, and introduces 'use_xhtml_mime' instead. when enabled, it sends application/xhtml+xml or text/html based on information from the "Accept" header.

item.title: Ticket #1091 (next[previous]_posts_link() not working when show X days option is set.) updated
item.dc:creator: dpbeatley
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1091 (next[previous]_posts_link() not working when show X days option is set.) created
item.dc:creator: dpbeatley
item.description: If your blog is set to show x days posts, the next[previous]_posts_links() functions do not return links. For example, I set my test blog to show only "1 day" posts and using the default theme (with ALL plug-ins disabled), a "previous" link is not returned. Setting the blog to show "1 posts" works fine. Bug must be in paging by day logic.

item.title: Ticket #1090 (list_author() parameter not being followed if admin account not called ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description:
"This should not be as it should only exclude the userlevel of 10 (that being the admin account)."

That would work only if the user level on one or more accounts has not been changed to 10 as well (through the db). I believe the possible best option is to exclude based on user login ('admin').

item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #1090 (list_author() parameter not being followed if admin account not called ...) updated
item.dc:creator: CanuckKev
item.description: Sorry, tag should be list_authors()....

item.title: Ticket #1090 (list_author() parameter not being followed if admin account not called ...) updated
item.dc:creator: CanuckKev
item.description:
Patch changed

Use the tag as such: < ?php list_authors(,TRUE,); ? > And the admin will be excluded on the list. Now change the "Admin" Nickname to anything other than admin, and it appears in the author list.

item.title: Ticket #1090 (list_author() parameter not being followed if admin account not called ...) created
item.dc:creator: CanuckKev
item.description:
The Codex lists the usage of the list_athor() tag as this: < ?php list_authors(optioncount, exclude_admin,

show_fullname, hide_empty, 'feed', 'feed_image'); ? >

The "exclude admin" option will not exclude admin if you change the Nickname of the admin to anything else but admin. This should not be as it should only exclude the userlevel of 10 (that being the admin account).

item.title: Ticket #1089 (Feeds do not have immutable GUID) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner, Status changed

item.title: Ticket #889 (Post Permalink do not work) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Yes, I'm curious why %category% breaks with the reduced rules. I understand why it breaks with the default rules and the "ungreedy" variants. It should be fine with PHP's PCRE since it can do reluctant, non-greedy matching.

The only option I can see to get %category% working with greedy versions mod_rewrite is to use a subcategory separator other than '/'.

item.title: Ticket #889 (Post Permalink do not work) updated
item.dc:creator: DarkCryst
item.description:
its php 4.3.1

I'll be clear - the reduced rules work, but they do the same thing as everything else - break on categories.

I'd prefer the ungreedy rules to work (404 is useful). Either way its rather odd.

item.title: Ticket #1089 (Feeds do not have immutable GUID) updated
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1089 (Feeds do not have immutable GUID) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description:
Every time someone upgrades to WordPress 1.5, their feeds shoot into my aggregator even though I read (most) of them from before the upgrade.

Phil Ringnalda points out that this is because WordPress is using the post permalink as the unique identifier for the feeds: ​http://www.sacarny.com/blog/2005/03/11/apologies/#comment-6994 ​http://philringnalda.com/blog/2005/03/003320.php

item.title: Ticket #1088 (login verb phrase and noun conflict) updated
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1088 (login verb phrase and noun conflict) created
item.dc:creator: Albert
item.description:
The attached patch changes the noun login to "username" in wp-login.php, wp-register.php, install.php, users.php, user-edit.php, profile.php and functions.php. Strings change so probably not for the 1.5.1 release. This does not change variables so the variable related to the username string is usually $user_login. It does not change the database either. POP3 is not modified.

Hopefully no verb phrases translated to username.

Briefly tested with a new database.

item.title: Ticket #1085 (Trackbacks send unformatted data) updated
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1085 (Trackbacks send unformatted data) created
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
Trackbacks use raw post content and excerpt without applying any filters. This leaves in unwanted formatting for users of Markdown and Textile.

Attached patch modifies do_trackbacks() to apply filters for the_content and the_excerpt, as well as the_title.

item.title: Ticket #1084 (Can't retrieve draft posts if Title is a link) updated
item.dc:creator: hooopla
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1084 (Can't retrieve draft posts if Title is a link) created
item.dc:creator: hooopla
item.description:
My post titles to point to things external rather than displaying the permalink page. A title would look something like...

<​http://www.google.ca>This is the post title</a>

Everything works the way it should with one exception.

I discovered today that if I save a draft version of an article, I can't retrieve it! In the Write Post and Manage Posts views there's a link to "Your drafts", but clicking on it takes me to the external site -- not to the draft post.

How do I get to my draft?

item.dc:creator: kim

item.title: Ticket #1083 (Default theme lacks sidebar background on Pages) created
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
In header.php the code assumes there is no sidebar for Pages. But in page.php the sidebar is used.

Attached patch fixes header.php to use the appropriate body background image for Pages, so the different background color is used for the sidebar.

item.title: Ticket #1082 (Superfluous newlines added to .htaccess on update) updated
item.dc:creator: Blu_Matt
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1082 (Superfluous newlines added to .htaccess on update) created
item.dc:creator: Blu_Matt
item.description: After a page update, when only the content has changed (i.e. no change to the page slug or choice of parent page) the .htaccess gets rewritten, undoing any customisations.

item.title: Ticket #1081 (Implement language tagging) updated
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1081 (Implement language tagging) created
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
The attached patch implements specifying the language for WordPress content:

  • send Content-Language (as header and in a meta tag where already done for Content-Type)
  • specify text processing language in the <html> tag

This also fixes the issue that feeds always specify the language as "en" (the default value of option rss_language) regardless of the language setting of the blog (such as WPLANG).

The patch deprecates rss_language and introduces a new option called blog_lang. It can be modified on the Reading Options page, below blog_charset.

The default value for blog_lang is based on WPLANG (using "en" if WPLANG is empty).

item.title: Ticket #882 (manage/pages shows pages from user with higher user level) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Depends on whether you ever want to use page_rows elsewhere or not (and what it's default behavior should be). If it's only to be used on Manage->Pages, then deleting the SQL query in edit-pages.php and applying your patch is probably best.

EDIT: typo.

edited on: 03-11-05 20:43

item.title: Ticket #1080 (admin password changed by other than admin) updated
item.dc:creator: georgianlady
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1080 (admin password changed by other than admin) created
item.dc:creator: georgianlady
item.description:
Someone accessed wp-login.php on my site and used the lost password link, and generated new passwords sent to my email address, but they are NOT like the emails generated by WP. I cannot replicate this problem. IP was logged in referrer on my site.

I couldn't use my real password to login, so I reinstated it using phpmyadmin. No other data *seems* to have been changed. After I was logged in, I tried to reproduce the problem and could not.

item.dc:creator: raena
item.description:
*sigh* the above bugger is me.

I figured it out on my own anyway. It's just one if-statement that needs to be made. I just don't know where to put it or how to make a diff or anything like that, though.

edited on: 03-11-05 05:40

item.title: Ticket #1004 (A less privileged user's post 'disappears' after they make an edit) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I doubt that it is intended behaviour for the post to get no status whatsoever after someone makes an edit. I mean, I looked in the database and there it was.

I further doubt that it would be intended behaviour for there to be no indication as to what happened to the post. Even when you log in as the less privileged user, it sits in the published list, not marked Private, and not in the list of drafts. It's confusing.
